maml:description.maml:para: Builds connection strings for a SQL Server database.
Builds connection strings for a SQL Server database.
Declares the application workload type when connecting to a database in an SQL Server Availability Group.
Specifies the name of the application associated with the connection string.
The wait time (in seconds) before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error. The default is 30 seconds.

When a connection is returned to the pool, its creation time is compared with the current time, and the connection is destroyed if that time span (in seconds) exceeds the value specified by Connection Lifetime.
A value of zero (0) causes pooled connections to have the maximum connection timeout.
The length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and throwing an exception. Default is 15 seconds.
The number of reconnection attempted after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Amount of time (in seconds) between each reconnection attempt after identifying that there was an idle connection failure.
Specifies the name of the database associated with the connection.
Boolean value that indicates whether SQL Server uses SSL encryption for all data sent between the client and server if the server has a certificate installed.
Specifies name or address of the partner server to connect to if the primary server is down.
Specifies the host name to use when validating the server certificate for the connection. When not specified, the server name from the Data Source is used for certificate validation.
Indicates whether User ID and Password are specified in the connection (when false) or whether the current Windows account credentials are used for authentication (when true).
Specifies the IP address family preference when establishing TCP connections.
The maximum number of connections that are allowed in the pool.
The minimum number of connections that are allowed in the pool.
Zero (0) in this field means no minimum connections are initially opened.
Specifies that an application can maintain multiple active result sets (MARS).

If your application is connecting to an AlwaysOn availability group (AG) on different subnets, setting MultiSubnetFailover=true provides faster detection of and connection to the (currently) active server.
Specifies the size in bytes of the network packets used to communicate with an instance of SQL Server.
Specifies the name or network address of the instance of SQL Server to connect to.
Indicates whether the channel will be encrypted while bypassing walking the certificate chain to validate trust.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Perform bulk copy against AdventureWorks database using the specified data table.
Perform bulk copy against AdventureWorks database using specified data row.

$DataTable = Get-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataTable $ConnectionString = 'Data Source=.;Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Integrated Security=True;'
Perform bulk copy using connection string.

$DataRow = $DataTableGet-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataRow $ConnectionString = 'Data Source=.;Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Integrated Security=True;'
Perform bulk copy against AdventureWorks database using specified data row.

$DataTable = Get-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataTable $SqlConnection = Connect-SqlServerInstance -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks
Perform bulk copy using the SQL connection.

$DataRow = Get-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;*' -OutputAs DataRow $SqlConnection = Connect-SqlServerInstance -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName AdventureWorks
Perform bulk copy using the SQL connection.
